---

I scanned the repository and reviewed the Markdown CV and three HTML CV variants without making changes.

### Findings
- cv.md: Comprehensive Turkish CV content with sections for contact, summary, work history, education, languages, skills, certificates, references, hobbies. Contains repeated lines like “Bu özgeçmiş, hesap sahibi tarafından indirilmiştir.” multiple times.
- mahmut_tekin_complete_cv.html: Turkish, richer visual design, Tailwind/AOS, PDF export via `html2pdf.js`, includes extra sections like “Özel Bilgiler”, references, and hobby areas. Data mirrors `cv.md`.
- mahmut_tekin_cv.html: Turkish/English mix (headings in English like “Work Experience”, “Education”; contact chip labels partly English). Similar structure and PDF export.
- mahmut-tekin-executive-cv.html: English executive-focused version with refined copy and consistent English UI, PDF export. Skills summarized as badges.
- mahmut-tekin-ozgecmis-2025.html: Turkish version similar to `mahmut_tekin_cv.html`, with English section headings and mixed-language contact chips.

### Notable inconsistencies and items to consider (no action taken)
- Mixed Turkish/English labels in `mahmut_tekin_cv.html` and `mahmut-tekin-ozgecmis-2025.html` (e.g., “Work Experience”, “Download as PDF”, “Birth”, “Nationality” alongside Turkish content).
- Education includes “Diploma Notu: 0/4” which may be unintended.
- Repeated “Bu özgeçmiş, hesap sahibi tarafından indirilmiştir.” lines in `cv.md`.
- References expose personal phone numbers and email; consider privacy if publishing.
- All HTMLs depend on external CDNs (Tailwind, AOS, Font Awesome, html2pdf.js); offline rendering will require internet.
- All CVs link to `person.jpg`, which exists.

Would you like me to harmonize language/labels per file, clean up repeats in `cv.md`, or keep one Turkish and one English variant as the canonical set?
